document.docAuthor: Shin, Chulwoo, Chaboo, Caroline S. & Clark, Shawn M.
document.docTitle: Asteriza tainosa Shin, Chaboo & Clark, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the endemic Hispaniolan genus Asteriza Chevrolat, 1836, with description of two new species (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Cassidinae: Ischyrosonychini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the endemic Hispaniolan genus Asteriza Chevrolat, 1836, with description of two new species (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Cassidinae: Ischyrosonychini)

heading.emphasis:
Asteriza tainosa Shin , Chaboo & Clark
, new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species is distinguished by the coloration and swollen maxillary and labial palpi. The elytra (
Figs. 4–5
,
47– 48
) are mainly tan with black punctures and the anterolateral angle of the male elytra is less acute than in other species. Maxillary palpomeres III–IV (
Fig. 34
) and labial palpomere III (Fig. 38 ) are more swollen than in other
Asteriza
species. The frontoclypeus (Fig. 30 ) is finely and shallowly punctate, brown, and usually divided by a mesal sulcus.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 42–46.
Asteriza tainosa
, new species , thorax. 42, pronotum, 43, prosternum, 44, mesonotum, 45, metanotum, 46, meso-metasternum. Scale bars = 1.0 mm.
